intro: Diodia polyseta, commonly known as false black nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and typically grows in wet, disturbed soils. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or purple flowers clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, dry seeds. Diodia polyseta is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along the edges of ponds.
